inclusion.criterion: recent acute stroke in the last 4 weeks
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: upper extremity plegia (Medical Research Council [MRC] grade 2 or less at the shoulder joint)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: aphasic alert patients provided they could follow simple directions given by verbal or gestural cues
inclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: anterior or severe inferior shoulder subluxation (3 cms)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: shoulder pain on passive range of 75 degrees forward flexion and 75 degrees abduction of the plegic arm
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: trophic skin changes and significant edema (shoulder-hand syndrome)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: prior rotator cuff surgery, patients with bursitis and/or biceps tendonitis
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: recent cardiac events (myocardial infarction, congestive cardiac failure, recent coronary artery bypass surgery)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: refuse to sign a written informed consent
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has severe lower extremity weakness and urinary retention s/p Foley catheter, high-dose steroids, hypertension, and chronic pain. The tumor is located in the T-L spine, unresectable anaplastic astrocytoma s/p radiation.
